reviews.review_msg: Reflecing back on my time as an undergad, Sugarman was possibly the best professor I've ever had. Do you listen to someone speak and are just in awe of how bright they are? That was my experience with Sugarman. Incredible speaker and possess profound knowledge. If you are looking for an easy class look ELSEWHERE. He will challenge you.

Prof had no understanding/empathy for the students and a self-righteous attitude toward everything. Had three big papers with no clear instructions. Despite that, I got a good mark but because I was sick a few times, he told me to drop the course! According to him "I missed a lot of the class material". Lectures were completely recorded online!
This professor will destroy your gpa.
Class designed to fail students. Your gpa will significantly go down.. Avoid at all costs!

Don't take a class with Jeff unless you absolutely have to. He's a good speaker, but he's unapproachable and harsh both in his marking style and during class. There is way too much reading for a 3rd year course. For a prof in the EDUC faculty, he should know better.

I'm a good student, honour roll -- this class lowered my GPA significantly.

The course is interesting, every lesson expands your mind. But the prof is harsh, does not have empathy and has a weird grading rubric, you never know what exactly is needed, because the topics are very general. Also, when he gives comments they sometimes are personal rather than only about the work.

Jeff is a great teacher, but he has high expectations. It feels like a genuine accomplishment when you get praise from him. He's passionate about education and it shows in both the material and in how he teaches. Critical engagement with the material is a must -- he doesn't want you to regurgitate ideas, he wants you to think.

EDUC 327 is definitely the hardest education course I have ever taken at SFU. While the course itself is interesting and it widened my perspective, I would never take a course with Jeff again. Sugarman has a specific grading/rubric that he doesnt share with the class. I did not know what he was looking for, which made the course difficult.

Sugarman has very clear expectations for what he wants in his papers. In order to do well, you must read every reading and take notes of EVERYTHING he says in the lectures. If you miss a lecture and don't get the notes from someone else you won't pass. If you apply his feedback and cite his arguments in your papers, you will do well.

Great prof. You need to complete the readings before class and attend lectures. His class definitely has changed my perspective on a lot of the things in Education and the material is really interesting, you can tell he is passionate about this course. The assignments not that bad, if you go to class and listen and take notes, assignments are easy

This professor is definitely the worst professor I've had in my five years at SFU. If you don't follow his idea and collaborative logic to complete the assignment, you will get very severe criticism and a lower grade than you can imagine! His criticism is a personal attack that directly attacks your thoughts, writing, and behavior and can be extrem

I learned a lot and the subject is very interesting. But he is a tough grader and is not very good at explaining assignments (format, style). The questions for the assignments are very general and he does not elaborate. His feedback is one sided , gives only harsh criticism so you do not know what to focus on for next time. But he knows his stuff.

By far the best course I've taken at SFU with the best prof. This course dismantled so many of my beliefs and made me question my understanding of the world. Sugarman is so well researched, intelligent, and passionate about what he teaches. Not an easy course, but so well worth it. Really makes you question 'common sense' policies in education.

Sugarman is an amazing professor. He is a hard marker but the course content is very interesting- if you engage in lecture and read the articles you will be just fine. This course opened my eyes to so many new ideas and perspectives, if you want to go into education I would very much recommend it!

Interesting topics, but he's a hard marker. He expects you to write papers from his point of view and he plays favorites. I've talked to other people who had their friend who had a good mark on previous assignments look over theirs and they somehow got a 10 mark difference for writing the same thing! Definitely biased when it comes to marking.

Good lecturer and enjoyed the discussions in class. His grading is difficult and he doesn't give much feedback. I showed up to class every week and took extensive notes to use for the papers. I was told that I didn't understand the material and that I was wrong, even though I wrote down everything he mentioned in class. Tough marker.

Jeff is a wonderful professor. He is extremely passionate and knowledgeable about the stuff he teaches. Definitely intelligent.  If you really love to write like me,  I really do recommend taking 327. It's not as hard as people think, and the essays are challenging but they are doable. Come on y'all, we're university students! Suck it up!

I really regret taking this class and would not recommend this prof or class to anyone. The structure of the class sets you up for failure. An average of 3 difficult articles were assigned each week, making it very easy to fall behind if you have anything going on in your life other than school. Sugarman gives you 1 week to write a 12 page paper.

Jeff was a great professor! I really enjoyed the information he brought to the course, and appreciated his knowledge. He is very passionate about this subject and this shows with how prepared he is. The course is quite difficult that is SO much reading! You need to read an average of three articles, we mandatory summaries do every class.

I found this proff to be insightful, thoughtful, and highly organized. If you took your time the outline gave you plenty of hints for how to outline your writing assignments. Demanding, but not unmanageable. Information that one really should have when going into counselling. If one has trouble with higher level thinking, this is not your course.

EDU 327 is a philo+education+psych. He aims high for students; hard marker but last assign is open topic essay so it's good. He is passionate, respect students, cute but 327 is very difficult compare to 220. Very intellectual teacher really enjoy.
